intro: Eupatorium luciae-brauniae, commonly known as the Braun's boneset, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and features tall, slender stems with serrated leaves. Its showy, white to pale blue flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The species is named in honor of botanist Lucie Braun, reflecting its historical significance in botanical studies.
